item.title: Into the Jungle
item.dc:creator: Vasan
item.description:

Into the Jungle Read More »

The post Into the Jungle appeared first on Aberrance.
item.content:encoded:
Hey, I can’t tell how deep I’m in. I mean,
I’ve been unmessing the mess I’ve been
But at times I feel like I’m in a dense green
Trekkin’ within with no sense of direction

“Oh, but why?” They ask. They always ask…because they don’t understand, I guess. It’s simple — we are all wired differently, and even with all worldly knowledge, wisdom does linger.

Depression and mental health are such ugly words for society. Perhaps, that’s also why people don’t discuss them as much as physical ailments. Or care for them unless a tragedy strikes. But, the truth of the matter is that our brain is a complex thing for us humans to comprehend, even when it’s our own. Also, it can be quite heavy, if not the heaviest thing on the planet.

So for those uninitiated who wonder, “Oh, but why?” Here’s an analogy — Depression can be like getting lost in a dense forest without GPS or compass. Like every other decision in life, you won’t even know when you veered off the trail. Once you do get lost, it’s like all your meticulous plans go for a toss.

You feel disoriented in the tangle of trees and bushes, wandering and cluelessly circling at one spot. It can be a dreadful and unsettling feeling to find yourself astray, cut off from the outside world.

Even if someone calls and guides you from the outside, you don’t know if you’ll make it. Your own creative brain plays its trickery, painting things grim than they probably are.

So don’t wander off into the wilderness as you don’t understand the depth of it. Your only recourse is to stay put. Share where you are and hopefully, somebody will come and get you. Until then just breathe, and look to the skies for a bigger picture.

The post Into the Jungle appeared first on Aberrance.

item.title: He for She?
item.dc:creator: Vasan
item.description:
To the boys, It’s not about breasts n’ vaginaRather a bit of humanity huhShow some decency not dicks duhWho even wants to see that bruh? If you’re out on midnight strollNo one’s gonna rape your soulNot the case if it’s a lady or dollEven men get defiled by testosterone If you’re working the same as …

He for She? Read More »

The post He for She? appeared first on Aberrance.
item.content:encoded:
To the boys,

It’s not about breasts n’ vagina
Rather a bit of humanity huh
Show some decency not dicks duh
Who even wants to see that bruh?

If you’re out on midnight stroll
No one’s gonna rape your soul
Not the case if it’s a lady or doll
Even men get defiled by testosterone

If you’re working the same as her
Take the pay in the same dollar
With merit, if she leads, you follow
If you don’t, you’re stupid n’ hollow

She cares for the man she likes
And it might not be you, yikes
Just let go of grudges n’ gripes
You ain’t the Tarzan of the apes

Babes aren’t there to offer babies
It’s her choice to be a mommy
When she does, be a caring hubby
And a good daddy, that’s all matey

No he for she, in her space let her be
Breathin’ free outta burka of society
Read her stories of Mary, Aisha n’ Draupadi
Just not through the lens of patriarchy

Idk feminism
but I reckon its close to humanity
A realization of individuality and treating the other person as equally important life and not as a commodity.

Refer
Quran: verses 4:34 and 33:35
Bible: verses Galatians 3:28, Hosea 4:14
Manusmriti: Chapter 3, Verse 61, Chapter 9, Verses 2-4, 9-13, 18, 74

For ages in the books written by men, we read their interpretation which is somewhat like — God, created two sexes, both equal in his eyes.
But, now as we know, there are more sexual variations. And just like that maybe just maybe the interpretations were biased or incomplete or even inaccurate. Also, why God has to be a he?
Who knows, right?

The post He for She? appeared first on Aberrance.

item.title: Blessed are you, Human
item.dc:creator: Vasan
item.description:
I asked God, “How does it feel to walk on water Author, founder, all-knowing father?” “Meh”, he reacted; dejected by his answer, I asked, “Why, O holy creator of matter?” “Er Mat, you can swim and scale the sea You can delude the feeling of being free Flee and pursue the heights of curiosity See …

Blessed are you, Human Read More »

The post Blessed are you, Human appeared first on Aberrance.
item.content:encoded:
I asked God,

“How does it feel to walk on water

Author, founder, all-knowing father?”

“Meh”, he reacted; dejected by his answer,

I asked, “Why, O holy creator of matter?”

“Er Mat, you can swim and scale the sea

You can delude the feeling of being free

Flee and pursue the heights of curiosity

See where you wanna be and in time be

Live and believe in the mystery of love

Flow and fare with the dolphin and dove

Off into the unknown sea and skies above

A world of wonders, you’ve always dreamt of

With limited time and lots of seconds to spare

Moments to create and memories to share

Mat, you are everything I want to be and care

Every time you swim, I find it to be fun and rare.”

Here, God tells Matthew, how it sucks to be all OMNIPRESENT, OMNIPOTENT AND OMNISCIENT. The divine dilemma.

And he reminds him how and why it’s a blessing to be human.

The post Blessed are you, Human appeared first on Aberrance.

item.title: I Killed a Rapist
item.dc:creator: Vasan
item.description:
Hey mom, I just killed a rapist An ape shit not meant to exist So I axed one off the hell’s hex list His own mum won’t miss him a bit Hey mom, you may insist killing is illicit But ill as it is, just like he didn’t resist I too did not desist instead …

I Killed a Rapist Read More »

The post I Killed a Rapist appeared first on Aberrance.
item.content:encoded:
Hey mom, I just killed a rapist
An ape shit not meant to exist
So I axed one off the hell’s hex list
His own mum won’t miss him a bit

Hey mom, you may insist killing is illicit
But ill as it is, just like he didn’t resist
I too did not desist instead I fixed it
With my flaming fist and raging wrist

Hey mom, I rekt it n’ the world won’t split
cuz pure excuse for a man got his dick slit
Hell I could just sit n’ spit on his evil spirit
Then forget it until you or my girl’s in the mix

Hey mom, but you know I couldn’t I wouldn’t
I would end the world unto all life’s descend
If something happened; so I’ll fight and fend
Till my strong brethren’s weak minds mend

The post I Killed a Rapist appeared first on Aberrance.

item.title: Man in the Making
item.dc:creator: Vasan
item.description:
Shawty, it’s about a man in the making And a life that’s out there for his taking Chasing a story with gold and glory Holes and holy well to be less lonely Hoary, for he felt sorry for being whorey Fine me if you find these lines phony Honey, if you relate, great it’ll be …

Man in the Making Read More »

The post Man in the Making appeared first on Aberrance.
item.content:encoded:
Shawty, it’s about a man in the making
And a life that’s out there for his taking
Chasing a story with gold and glory
Holes and holy well to be less lonely
Hoary, for he felt sorry for being whorey
Fine me if you find these lines phony
Honey, if you relate, great it’ll be thorny
Or else spineless whine of a cornless corny

Wrote what I caught as my thoughts fought
Wrought a lot, still, dot dot… dotless drought
Naught nada nothing to note, nothing to gloat
Gotta plot a lot to find just one spot for this GOAT
Hot red-hot ramen in my head, stop I’m fuckin’ fed
Up with meeting my ends which ends up dead
Heads up I’d rather be dead now than be another
Subpar greyhead in deathbed weeping for the reaper

I admit I was in a vacuum within my darkroom
Trying to seat my feet in others’ shoes’ no excuse
And as I chose to cage my insecurities in a closet
I was lost, locked in n’ left with a loose neck noose
But rose-tinted memories were all a lost cause needs
At times when grasping at straws and flimsy reeds
Held me together under the rain n’ thunder’s reign
Trusting the seeds I’d sown both in words n’ deeds

Hey mister the world’s bloody sinister n’ Imma sinner
Err is to be me human who killed his way to the heaven
I’m no angel nor lucifer crucified for the deadly seven
But off the seven point seven billion, am I even a good one?
Hmm hum this might sound like umm rant dumb
Ho hum voice of people in drains, dregs n’ dump
Numb as they come from beyond the flattering filters
Glitter n’ glam, where hustle’s real, fun n’ joy the fillers

So pull back n’ peek a panic attack of a big blown crack
Quack croak cry of a hunchback, out of his whack
With a throat lump bigger than a boulder on his back
Weighing on a heart that’s chronically homesick
Click-clack boom thoughts like 9mm headshots fired
And tired connecting dots shattered yet silly inspired
By a few indistinct and distant dreams and desires
Reaching ’em is my sole resolve until this Life retires

Now I’m waving goodbye to a past that passed by
And the feet drift to a road less traveled by
Although the eyes find them seemingly strayed
But my heart says, “Leave it, let the way decide”
So, this is a story of a man’s legacy in the making
And about a life that’s out there for his taking
See if you relate, great it’ll be a complex melody
Else willy-nilly, it’ll come out as a confused medley

The post Man in the Making appeared first on Aberrance.

item.title: One Shot One Moment
item.dc:creator: Vasan
item.description:
I write, I erase, I write and I rephrase Day in and day out, I’m on a ceaseless chase Each day I wake up buried and broken Breathing for my one shot, one moment In the cusp of darkness, as a new dawn stares With a greed for life, my fuckin’ mind flares I hear …

One Shot One Moment Read More »

The post One Shot One Moment appeared first on Aberrance.
item.content:encoded:
I write, I erase, I write and I rephrase
Day in and day out, I’m on a ceaseless chase

Each day I wake up buried and broken
Breathing for my one shot, one moment

In the cusp of darkness, as a new dawn stares
With a greed for life, my fuckin’ mind flares

I hear the wind rustle, rousing me to wrestle
Hustle and bustle my way thru mindless muscles

I get off the bed half dead mind spread
Still led in search for my everyday bread

Breath stuck like a stone in the throat
Just gasping for my one shot, one moment

Thus I write, I erase, I write and I rephrase
Day in and day out, I’m on a ceaseless chase

A tribute to Eminem

The post One Shot One Moment appeared first on Aberrance.

item.title: An Endlessly Exciting Girl
item.dc:creator: Vasan
item.description:
To express endlessly exciting Dear words, he is inviting You to land in rhyming To etch a beauty in writing I have held time by its throat You have the liberty you sought Have a taste of my thoughts Free my feelings laced in love knots Ahead, thus the words marched headstrong To the home …

An Endlessly Exciting Girl Read More »

The post An Endlessly Exciting Girl appeared first on Aberrance.
item.content:encoded:
To express endlessly exciting
Dear words, he is inviting
You to land in rhyming
To etch a beauty in writing

I have held time by its throat
You have the liberty you sought
Have a taste of my thoughts
Free my feelings laced in love knots

Ahead, thus the words marched headstrong
To the home of my heart, they trailed along

Then they tried to stir the blur to confer
What I prefer, what do I like about her?

I first echoed my favorite reply “I.D.K.”
Then I said, if I may, if I had my way, I would say

She is tempting like the hook of a song
Where melody and rhythm muse to belong

Her smile, breathtaking as the seamless skies
It feels like a bliss that sailed across several lives

Her lips, soft and tender like red rose petals
A kiss would feel like when the sun meets the sea and settles

If you’re close do gaze at her browny eyes
You would see the space where a riddled star lies

A look of her simply slices my heart a little
Crumbling my crimson heart, soft and brittle

Her hair falls on the elegant curves of her neck
Via the valleys behind the seashell ears onto a speck

Yes a speck like the dark spot of the moon
With a glow which would swoon in my rune

If only I had it my way, I will endlessly draw the “Endlessly Exciting Girl” with such distorted details. But words always vaporize and my memory isn’t loyal. I believe my words won’t fail me this time and I would immortalize a mortal forever in my words.

Thus, letters are landing and words are whipping into shape something special, something endlessly exciting.

The post An Endlessly Exciting Girl appeared first on Aberrance.

item.title: Back in my rhyme
item.dc:creator: Vasan
item.description:
The year began, I was longing for the love I felt I lacked While mending a smile that was cracked Even the butterfly wings that fluttered In time, they too fell weak and withered So I played along as a reclusive monk With eyes burrowed in a dark furrow I was torn between right and …

Back in my rhyme Read More »

The post Back in my rhyme appeared first on Aberrance.
item.content:encoded:
The year began,

I was longing for the love I felt I lacked
While mending a smile that was cracked
Even the butterfly wings that fluttered
In time, they too fell weak and withered

So I played along as a reclusive monk
With eyes burrowed in a dark furrow
I was torn between right and wrong
Peace in pieces split in past and morrow

But then a day, I finally faced my crime
Which pushed me back in my rhyme
So now no more what-ifs, ifs, and buts
Well, it is high time that I bust my butt
I gotta rewrite my story outta this rut

The post Back in my rhyme appeared first on Aberrance.

item.title: A soft kiss of rain
item.dc:creator: Vasan
item.description:
Like the first drop from heaven, you fell You softly caressed and I fell in your spell In a jiff, a whiff, a wind, I came into sense It felt like that moment mattered in all my tense I let the world move ahead and simply stood Soaked, drenched and all my worries dripped Ether …

A soft kiss of rain Read More »

The post A soft kiss of rain appeared first on Aberrance.
item.content:encoded:
Like the first drop from heaven, you fell
You softly caressed and I fell in your spell

In a jiff, a whiff, a wind, I came into sense
It felt like that moment mattered in all my tense

I let the world move ahead and simply stood
Soaked, drenched and all my worries dripped

Ether showered upon me and I was wet again
A cool dew drizzled down my brain and vein

It all felt blissful like every pure feeling should
Would’ve locked up time in our bubble if I could

Yes, like the first drop from heaven, you fell
You softly caressed and I simply fell in your spell

The post A soft kiss of rain appeared first on Aberrance.

item.title: Us Against The World
item.dc:creator: Vasan
item.description:
You’ll feel the words choke up and bleed blue If for a while, you walk a mile in his shoes In a crack amidst a world of little and more Life’s just day chores and nightly heartsore As the lungs gasp till the end of my days His split mind will shatter in varied ways …

Us Against The World Read More »

The post Us Against The World appeared first on Aberrance.
item.content:encoded:
You’ll feel the words choke up and bleed blue
If for a while, you walk a mile in his shoes

In a crack amidst a world of little and more
Life’s just day chores and nightly heartsore

As the lungs gasp till the end of my days
His split mind will shatter in varied ways

My wicked heart will leave and stray
While the dreamy reality resets like always

Yet we will be together when it ends
To put a period to our ways and words

Buried as one in the valley of kings
‘It was all a dream’, our elegy sings

For him, about him, my antonym
I’ll drop the eyes with no more disguise

In your flow, you wouldn’t know
It’d been all for him, about him, my antonym

The post Us Against The World appeared first on Aberrance.
